com.finch4alice

Interface FinchSensorState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FinchHTTP

    public interface FinchSensorState

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getLeftLightSensor

        default int getLeftLightSensor()
        Returns the value of the left light sensor. Valid values range from 0 to 255, with higher values indicating more light is being detected by the sensor.
        Returns:
        The current light level at the left light sensor

      • getRightLightSensor

        default int getRightLightSensor()
        Returns the value of the right light sensor. Valid values range from 0 to 255, with higher values indicating more light is being detected by the sensor.
        Returns:
        The current light level at the right light sensor

      • isLeftLightSensor

        default boolean isLeftLightSensor(double limit)
        Returns true if the specified limit is less than the left light sensor value.
        Parameters:
        limit - The value the light sensor needs to exceed
        Returns:
        whether the light sensor exceeds the value specified by limit

      • isRightLightSensor

        default boolean isRightLightSensor(double limit)
        Returns true if the specified limit is less than the right light sensor value.
        Parameters:
        limit - The value the light sensor needs to exceed
        Returns:
        whether the light sensor exceeds the value specified by limit

      • getLightSensors

        int[] getLightSensors()
        Returns a 2 integer array containing the current values of both light sensors. The left sensor is the 0th array element, and the right sensor is the 1st element.
        Returns:
        A 2 int array containing both light sensor readings.

      • isObstacleLeftSide

        default boolean isObstacleLeftSide()
        Returns true if there is an obstruction in front of the left side of the robot.
        Returns:
        Whether an obstacle exists in front of the left side of the robot.

      • isObstacleRightSide

        default boolean isObstacleRightSide()
        Returns true if there is an obstruction in front of the right side of the robot.
        Returns:
        Whether an obstacle exists in front of the right side of the robot.

      • isObstacle

        default boolean isObstacle()
        Returns true if either left or right obstacle sensor detect an obstacle.
        Returns:
        Whether either obstacle sensor sees an obstacle.

      • getObstacleSensors

        boolean[] getObstacleSensors()
        Returns the value of both obstacle sensors as 2 element boolean array. The left sensor is the 0th element, and the right sensor is the 1st element.
        Returns:
        The values of left and right obstacle sensors in a 2 element array

      • getXAcceleration

        default double getXAcceleration()
        This method returns the current X-axis acceleration value experienced by the robot.

        Values for acceleration range from -1.5 to +1.5g. The X-axis is the beak-tail axis, with positive values indicating acceleration in the direction of the beak.

        Returns:
        The X-axis acceleration value. If unable to connect, returns NaN.

      • getYAcceleration

        default double getYAcceleration()
        This method returns the current Y-axis acceleration value experienced by the robot.

        Values for acceleration range from -1.5 to +1.5g. The Y-axis is the wheel-to-wheel axis, with positive values indicating acceleration in the direction of the right wheel.

        Returns:
        The Y-axis acceleration value. If unable to connect, returns NaN.

      • getZAcceleration

        default double getZAcceleration()
        This method returns the current Z-axis acceleration value experienced by the robot.

        Values for acceleration range from -1.5 to +1.5g. The Z-axis runs perpendicular to the Finch's circuit board, with positive values indicating acceleration toward the bottom of the Finch.

        Returns:
        The Z-axis acceleration value. If unable to connect, returns NaN.

      • getXOrientationAngle

        default double getXOrientationAngle()
        This method returns the current X-axis angle of the robot relative to a plane parallel to the ground.

        Values for the angle are in the range [-Pi, Pi]. The X-axis is the beak-tail axis.

        Returns:
        The X-axis angle value in radians, with 0 meaning the Finch is level on the beak-tail axis, negative values meaning the beak is angled downward, and positive values meaning the beak is angled up. If unable to connect, returns NaN.

      • getYOrientationAngle

        default double getYOrientationAngle()
        This method returns the current Y-axis angle of the robot relative to a plane parallel to the ground.

        Values for the angle are in the range [-Pi, Pi]. The Y-axis is the wheel-to-wheel axis.

        Returns:
        The Y-axis angle value in radians, with 0 meaning the Finch is level on the wheel-to-wheel axis, negative values meaning the left wheel is angled downward, and positive values meaning the left wheel is angled up. If unable to connect, returns NaN.

      • getOrientationAngles

        default double[] getOrientationAngles()
        Use this method to simultaneously return the current X and Y orientation angles experienced by the robot.

        Values for the angles are in the range [-Pi, Pi]. When the robot is on a flat surface, the X and Y angles should both be close to 0.

        Returns:
        an array of 2 doubles containing the X and Y orientation angle values. For the X-axis, negative values mean the beak is angled downward, and positive values mean the beak is angled up. For the Y-axis, negative values mean the left wheel is angled downward, and positive values mean the left wheel is angled up. If unable to connect, returns null.

      • getAccelerations

        double[] getAccelerations()
        Use this method to simultaneously return the current X, Y, and Z accelerations experienced by the robot.

        Values for acceleration can be in the range of -1.5g to +1.5g. When the robot is on a flat surface, X and Y should be close to 0g, and Z should be near +1.0g.

        Returns:
        an array of 3 doubles containing the X, Y, and Z acceleration values. If unable to connect, returns null.

      • getOrientation

        String getOrientation()
        Returns the current orientation of the Finch.
        Returns:
        When connected to a Finch, returns one of: "Level", "Upside Down", "Beak Up", "Beak Down", "Left Wing Down", "Right Wing Down", "In Between". If unable to connect, returns null.

      • isBeakUp

        default boolean isBeakUp()
        This method returns true if the beak is up (Finch sitting on its tail), false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if beak is pointed at ceiling

      • isBeakDown

        default boolean isBeakDown()
        This method returns true if the beak is pointed at the floor, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if beak is pointed at the floor

      • isFinchLevel

        default boolean isFinchLevel()
        This method returns true if the Finch is on a flat surface
        Returns:
        true if the Finch is level

      • isFinchUpsideDown

        default boolean isFinchUpsideDown()
        This method returns true if the Finch is upside down, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if Finch is upside down

      • isLeftWingDown

        default boolean isLeftWingDown()
        This method returns true if the Finch's left wing is pointed at the ground
        Returns:
        true if Finch's left wing is down

      • isRightWingDown

        default boolean isRightWingDown()
        This method returns true if the Finch's right wing is pointed at the ground
        Returns:
        true if Finch's right wing is down

      • getTemperature

        double getTemperature()
        The current temperature reading at the temperature probe.

        The value returned is in Celsius. To get Fahrenheit from Celsius, multiply the number by 1.8 and then add 32.

        Returns:
        The current temperature in degrees Celsius
        See Also:
        getTemperatureFahrenheit()

      • isTemperature

        default boolean isTemperature(double limit)
        Returns true if the temperature is less than the value specified by limit, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        limit - The value the temperature needs to exceed in Celcius
        Returns:
        true if the temperature exceeds the value specified by limit

      • getTemperatureFahrenheit

        default double getTemperatureFahrenheit()
        The current temperature reading at the temperature probe, in Fahrenheit.
        Returns:
        The current temperature in degrees Fahrenheit
        See Also:
        getTemperature()

      • getStatusReport

        default String getStatusReport()
        Retrieves a brief status report string containing the current status of the Finch.
        Returns:
        A brief status report string containing the current status of the Finch.
